fields.summary: Exception during installation when entering new license after old license has already been entered

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-27872].
  {panel}

This problem (JRA-1844) has been known since 2003.

When you add an attachment, you are asked for a comment. Most users assume the comment will be associated and displayed with the attachment, like a caption on a picture.

However, in the Comment tab panel (which is the default, in our installation at least), the comments and the attachments are displayed separately - there is no way to tell from a comment which attachment it refers to, nor even that it refers to any attachment! And conversely there is no way to see, from the list of attachments, the comment that was entered with each.

It also means that you have comments that don't make sense (e.g. "stacktrace") because they were written as if they were a label for the attachment rather than a stand-alone comment.

Attached screenshots on this issue show the orphaned comments and attachments.

The "Activity" tab panel now shows the association between comments and attachments. But who, faced with the above situation, would guess that they needed to click on "Activity" in order to solve the problem?

Requested fixes, in order of preference:

1) In Comments tab panel, for each attachment show the associated comment (possibly a collapsed, expandable summary); and for each comment that has an attachment, show the filename as a link to the attachment. OR,

2) For each attachment comment and attachment in the Comments tab panel, show some indicator of an association (e.g. an icon), a tooltip that tells the user there is an associated comment/attachment, and a clear instruction on how to find out what the associated comment/attachment is (e.g. click on the Activity tab at the top of the Activity section of the page). OR,

3) When asking the user to enter a comment, notify them prominently that there will be no association displayed (in the default panel) between their comment and the thing they're commenting on, so they need to make the association explicit in the comment (e.g., "Attaching foo.txt, the error log from bar.exe").
fields.summary: comments and attachments need to be visually associated in Comment tab pane.

fields.description:
Hi,

On Jira Workflow designer,, mixed language (half German- half English) appears when the Jira Startup properties are set to German.

To reproduce:
# Start a Jira instance with {{-Duser.language=de -Duser.country=DE}}. This will default Jira language to German.
# Go to General Configuration and set the Jira language to 'English UK'
# Go to Workflow Designer and see that half the text appears in English while half the text appears in German.
# Also, none of the labels are translated.


Regards,
Ruchi

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-27869].
  {panel}

During internal efforts to improve our full re-indexing time we found a huge performance boost by disabling the MySQL query cache during the indexing period. This dropped our re-index time from 45 minutes to ~23 minutes. This figures above were obtained by running the re-index 5 times with and without the query cache enabled.

While our testing involved disabling the MySQL query cache completely in the server, I believe the same effect can obtained by having Jira pre-fix all indexing {{SELECT}} queries to the DB with "{{SQL_NO_CACHE}}"
[http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.0/en/query-cache-in-select.html]

The Jira re-indexing process can detect the fact that MySQL is being used via JDBC, and use the "{{SQL_NO_CACHE}}" prefix accordingly.

Please note our testing was done on MySQL 5.1, so I can't speak to the benefits of this change on 5.5/5.6
Also in case it's not obvious, this fix will only benefit those users who already have the MySQL query cache enabled.

FWIW, the same principle above may apply to other DB-intensive scenarios where little to no queries will be the same. So it's possible bulk operations and the integrity checker may benefit from this change also.

All testing performed on Jira 4.4.4
fields.summary: Disable query caching during re-indexing operations (MySQL)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-27864].
  {panel}

Recently we tightened up security in all JIRA OnDemand instances by not allowing arbitrary HTML in the announcement banner. We fixed this vulnerability by only allowing plain text or [wiki markup|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/WikiRendererHelpAction.jspa?section=all] in the announcement banner. 

We would like to come up with a compromise if possible that still allows customers to accomplish what they were previously using the announcement banner for in a secure way. In order for that to happen we would like to know how you were using the announcement banner. Please comment on this issue to let us know how you have been using HTML in the announcement banner.

Regards,

Roy Krishna
JIRA OnDemand Product Manager

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-27854].
  {panel}

When viewing an issue with a Multi User Picker custom field, the values are sorted by full name. However, when editing, the values are sorted by Username instead. This causes problems in systems where the usernames are significantly different than full names. There's no easy way to determine which username matches which full name. Because the sorting is not consistent, you can't simply note the position of the full name on the view screen and then remove that username on the edit screen because the users are not guaranteed to be in the same order.

An example of this would be three users:

||Full Name||Username
|Brian Curnow|bcurnow
|Just Some User|auser
|Test User 1|testuser1

If you add these users to the Multi User custom field, in view they will be sorted in the following order:

* Brian Curnow
* Just Some User
* Test User 1

However, if you edit the issue, the values will be sorted in the following order:

* auser
* bcurnow
* testuser1

The sorting should be consistent in all views, either always sort by username or always sort by full name.

An alternative, and I can open an additional issue if necessary, is to change the rendering of the edit view so it works like component. Where each value is rendered as a bubble containing the full name with a X in the corner that will remove the value.
fields.summary: Fix sorting of users for the Multi User custom field type

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-27839].
  {panel}

h3.Symptoms
When exporting all fields to Excel (XLS) the "Business Value" and "Story Points" are missing.
Even when adding them manually to the columns (Tools > Configure Columns) this won't work.
It also occurs with or without the presence of data on these fields.

h3.Steps to reproduce
* Go to "Issues";
* Click on "Search";
* Click on "Views";
* Select "Excel (All fields)"

The generated XLS file won't export the "Business Value" and "Story Points" columns.

h3.Diagnosis
The behaviour seems to be because the custom fields "Story Points" or "Business Value" are not valid for at least one of the issues which are returned by the search.

h3.Workaround
h4.Option 1: Modify the query to include only issues which have "Story Points" or "Business Value"
Modify the query to filter only issues for which the custom fields "Story Points" or "Business Value" are valid by appending the following to the query:
{code}
AND ("Story Points" is EMPTY or "Story Points" is not EMPTY)
{code}
or
{code}
AND ("Business Value" is EMPTY or "Business Value" is not EMPTY)
{code}

h4.Option 2: Add "Story Points" and/or "Business Value" to all issue types and projects
Note that this could have global impact on your JIRA since it affects configuration for all issue types and projects.
# Go to JIRA Administration > Issues > Custom Fields.
# Scroll down to "Story Points" and from the gear wheel icon, click on Configure.
# For "Choose applicable issue types", select "Any issue type" or choose all issue types which might be returned as part of the search.
# For "Choose applicable context", select "Global context" or choose specific projects that are included in the search.
# Press "Modify" to save the configuration

The workarounds are thanks to this [thread on Atlassian Answers|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/100693/story-points-not-showing-up-in-issue-navigator-or-export-but-shows-up-in-configure-columns].
fields.summary: "Business Value" and "Story Points" are not exported when going through Views > Excel (All fields).

fields.description:
In previous versions of JIRA, the Activity Stream populated content using the baseurl from the incoming request. To be more specific, it would populate data using the URL that the user connected to JIRA with. 

In newer versions of JIRA, 5.0+ as far as I know, the Activity Stream data is populated using the Base URL in the General Configuration. I have been advised that this is not the intended usage of of how the Activity Stream supposedly works.
fields.summary: Activity Stream using General Configurations Base URL for content

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-27833].
  {panel}

In our installation of JIRA 4.4.5 the jira.issue.action.order is set to ascending.  When the issue order toggle control is used to change the action order in the UI (to descending), and the issue is subsequently updated, the action order reverts back to ascending.  This behavior (I believe) is a departure from previous versions, where the selected issue action order would persist, at least for the session.

It would be nice if the issue action order selected by the user would persist, at least for the session. Ideally, it would be swell if control of this behavior could be delegated to individual users, via a preference setting.

Further, when issue activities are collapsed, they appear expanded if a new activity is added. It would be great if this setting could be made to stick, i.e if a user collapses activities, they stay that way until the user expands them.

Thanks for your consideration.

Chris
fields.summary: jira issue action order and display behavior

fields.description:
I was able to figure out that collapseTwixiBlocksFromCookie runs twice if the block exists as value in the cookie and therefore toggles the block twice. First it collapses the custom field's block which is right but then expands it again which is not the desired result. This can only be observed if a breakpoint is set for the appropriate function, otherwise it just looks like it never remembers the setting at all.

I checked all versions from 4.4.2 until 4.4.5 and the problem occurs in every version. Jira 5.0.2 does not contain the bug.

I have been searching for an existing bug like crazy but was unable to find one.

As reference: We are using a custom field to store stack traces, therefore it is quite obvious/annoying to us that it always expands the block.
fields.summary: Custom fields get expanded even though cookie says not to

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-27813].
  {panel}

I think this is a pervasive problem. Generally much worse than SOAP APIs provided. Some APIs are worse than others. Lets use a simple REST API as an example of the problem. Voting api - http://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/latest/#id162079.

bq. 404: Returned if the user cannot vote for any reason. (The user is the reporter, the user does not have permission to vote, voting is disabled in the instance, the issue does not exist, etc.)

So what is the reason?
# user is reporter - I suppose the API user can get the issue and see if the current user is the reporter
# user does not have permission (to the issue?  or no permission to vote?) - I suppose in this case, trying to get the issue will answer the first question. Not sure about how to find out if the the user has permission to vote
# voting is disabled - how could one figure that out
# issue does not exist - get issue API again would answer that
# user has already voted - not listed in the documentation text, but also gives 404 

Also, why would one expect a *404 - not found* like exception for some of the reasons listed?

The bottom line is the API user has to go through various other actions to figure out what the problem is and sometimes cannot even narrow it down.
fields.summary: Poor error reporting from REST APIs
Internationalisation CustomFields Easily?

But they do it manually, so there is an Issue-A and they create Issue-B, Issue-C and Issue-D in different projects and then they link these issues to Issue-A.

Is the Create and link plugin able to link an issue to more than 1 issues at the same time?

Best regards,

Rumi

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-27800].
  {panel}

Another error with in-comments mentions, this time to do with Wiki Style Renderer.

h5. Steps to Recreate

# Disable Wiki Style Renderer for comments/description/et all.
# Mentioning @user when they are not a watcher, reporter or assignee does not render the WML. See {{Watching.jpg}}.
# Mentioning @user when they *are* a watcher, reporter or assignee renders the WML. See {{Not_Watching.jpg}}.

I believe this is caused by different templates being used for the two actions. It would seem the correct behaviour is not to render the WML as the renderer is disabled for the comments field in this example.

h5. Workaround

Configure the [Wiki Style Renderer|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+Renderers#ConfiguringRenderers-WikiStyleRenderer].
fields.summary: In comments mentions when Wiki Markup is disabled

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-27797].
  {panel}

Project names are mutable. Project Keys are immutable. If you have queries based on a project and you then change the project name all existing queries are now broken.

For example, I had a project called "roadmap" and had queries built for it (i.e. "project=roadmap AND ...") to be used within confluence pages. We needed to add another project called "X roadmap". After noticing my lack of forethought on the naming of "roadmap" I changed the project name to "Y roadmap" which in turn broke all existing confluence pages.

Just think it would be easy to translate project names to keys in the tool itself.

Thanks.
fields.summary: JQL should internally translate project name to project key

*Steps to reproduce*
# Change the language translation of JIRA from English to German
# All the fields like the status, priority and resolution are translated approprietly
# Create a link between two issues
# Hover your mouse around the issue priority and the status in the issue links section
# You will observe that they are still represented in English instead of German.

*Workaround*

fields.description:
STRM issue: https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/STRM-2169

When restricting an activity stream by a username that has an underscore in it (in our case, wga_csucew), the activity stream returns No activity was found. This includes the Activity stream on the profile page for that particular user.

This is a regression since JIRA 4.4, where this was working. Going to the RSS feed and adding a backslash before the _ (i.e., escaping it) makes the activity stream work - so I'm assuming this is some kind of escaping issue.

We use Oracle for our JIRA database.
fields.summary: Activity streams restricting by usernames with a backslash in do not work

The usability of nested versions could be improved. Currently:

* You need GreenHopper.
* Nesting the versions occurs inside GreenHopper and not in the Managing Versions page where most naive users would look.
* You need to enable a project to be GreenHopper enabled. If you have hundreds, this gets daunting
* It pollutes the fixversion field with multiple fixversion values. This isn't a big deal but it's a consequence of the workaround GH had to do. 
* Delegating this task to project admins isn't always possible due to the learning curve. Here's a [doc I found|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AUG/Jira+Versioning+Process+using+Nested+Versions] on how one might do it.
fields.summary: Improve nested versions

fields.description:
There has been quite a few support cases that has reported sync'ing problems, resulting in this error:
{code}
2012-01-17 13:18:48,791 ERROR [QuartzScheduler_Worker-9] [atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingDirectoryPoller] pollChanges Error occurred while refreshing the cache for directory [ 10000 ].
com.atlassian.crowd.exception.OperationFailedException: java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException: com.atlassian.crowd.exception.OperationFailedException: org.springframework.ldap.InvalidSearchFilterException: Empty filter; nested exception is javax.naming.directory.InvalidSearchFilterException: Empty filter; remaining name 'DC=pirates,DC=oceans,DC=com'
    at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.ldap.cache.UsnChangedCacheRefresher.synchroniseAllGroups(UsnChangedCacheRefresher.java:284)
    at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.ldap.cache.AbstractCacheRefresher.synchroniseAll(AbstractCacheRefresher.java:41)
{code}

This is interpreted as a filter field being empty, but checking but User and Group Object filters, they are both populated.  It was finally found that this was the problem:
{code}ldap.roles.disabled: "false"{code}

Roles have been deprecated for years in Crowd, but it had been ported into JIRA/Confluence via embedded Crowd.  Still the code is there and is simply set to be disabled via the directory attribute, as mentioned above.  I'm not sure how this can be enabled, there support has receive a number of tickets relating to this.

For now, I've written this article for the issue:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/InvalidSearchFilterException%3A+Empty+filter+when+Synchronising+LDAP
fields.summary: LDAP sync problems when "ldap.roles.disabled" is to "false"
Track Issue creator separately from Reporter
Field restrictions on BaseURL too tight

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-27775].
  {panel}

Error creating issue: Unable to find field 'customfield_xxxxx'

After deleting an unused custom field, customers started complaining about receiving error message in title during issue creation. Issues were actually created, but some data was broken so I had to use JIRA integrity checker to correct problems.

Before removing the custom field, I removed it from all screens and field configurations. Afterwards JIRA did not complain during its deletion. But later, when customers complained, I found out that it was actually used in two workflows. I had to XML export the workflows, remove field references, import new workflows and adjust all projects' workflow schemes to fix the problem. It took a lot of time to find the cause and fix the problem.

JIRA should warn that a custom field appears in at least one workflow before letting it being deleted.
fields.summary: JIRA Should Warn if a Custom Field Appears in Workflow before Letting It Being Deleted

You reported the bug.

fields.summary: Modify default email templates to say why email was sent

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-27772].
  {panel}

At least three requests for this feature have been made years ago but were refused to be addressed by Atlassian then. Unfortunately I could not reopen them so I am creating this new request because it is important for us:
JRA-3532 (created 2004)
JRA-15001 (created 2008)
JRA-19412 (created 2009)

I believe that this feature got more weight with more and stricter data and IT security acts and guidelines in today's businesses. Most important feature for me is a configurable expiry date of a user account. We too have our customers access our JIRA. We have no control over their employment there and we need to provide an appropriate security behavior to disable accounts automatically based on conditions. In our case, our internal security guideline for user accounts requires us to disable each external account after 365 days until they are requested to be reinstated.

I would like to request that Atlassian honors data and IT security requirments better ba adding these features to user management:
* User account expiry by date or duration
* Password expiry by date or duration
* Feature to disable an account
fields.summary: User account and password expiry

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-27769].
  {panel}

See attached screenshot for a visual explanation.

The <header> area in which the "Add User" button is contained is floated. As such, the <header> has no height, and the <form> element overlaps it. Consequentially, the button's clickable area is obstructed by the overlap.

Ensuring the contents of the <header> area affect its height should resolve the problem.

Adding either a <br class="clear"/> or adding an overflow:auto; CSS style to the <header> will allow floated contents to affect the height of the <header>, thus solve the problem.
fields.summary: 'Add User' button in OnDemand can't always be clicked

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-27763].
  {panel}

As suggested by Arthur Gonçalves [Atlassian], here are my suggestion to help improve the upgrading process of JIRA (in our case, from 4.3.4 to 5.0.1). Please refer to JSP-122399.

During the upgrade, indicate the plugins that are no longer compatible or out of date and deactivate them. You could also add an options to remove those plugins.

You should be able to select the folder/place where you want to install the application (not use the previous folder).

Give the user (that performs the updates) an option to reconfigure the email settings

Re-install the service service (I had to do that manually and it was a pain since I wasn't the original installer).

Allow the use of multiple ports during the upgrade process instead of having to go through the xml file modification or use the JIRA web UI.
fields.summary: List of improvements that should be done to make JIRA upgrades easier.

fields.description:
The mentions drop-down ignores user input when it is waiting for a reply from the server. On servers like JAC that take literally 5 seconds to respond, this breaks the drop-down. Steps to reproduce:

1. Open a new comment input and type "@rsmar". Note that the browser has made a request for {{https://jira.atlassian.com/rest/api/2/user/viewissue/search?issueKey=JRA-26287&projectKey=JRA&maxResults=10&username=r&_=1333404334727}} (request to auto-complete "r", the first character typed)

2. 5 seconds later when the response comes back, the list of suggested users has little relation to what I typed:

!autocomplete rsmar.png!

3. At this point if I type the last remaining character I get a useful autocomplete:

!autocomplete rsmart.png!
fields.summary: Mentions drop-down doesn't autocomplete properly on slow connections

Caused by: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Unable to create thumbnail image of attachment with id:19799
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.thumbnail.DefaultThumbnailManager.doGetThumbnail(DefaultThumbnailManager.java:145)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.thumbnail.DefaultThumbnailManager.getThumbnails(DefaultThumbnailManager.java:60)
        at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor419.invoke(Unknown Source)
        at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:597)
        at com.atlassian.util.profiling.object.ObjectProfiler.profiledInvoke(ObjectProfiler.java:81)
        at com.atlassian.jira.config.component.SwitchingInvocationHandler.invoke(SwitchingInvocationHandler.java:28)
        at $Proxy147.getThumbnails(Unknown Source)
        at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.issue.ViewIssue.getThumbnails(ViewIssue.java:581)
        ... 237 more
{code}

h3. Steps to reproduce
This gets easier to reproduce as the number of attached images increases. 
To show some images as thumbnails and others as plain files, just press F5 twice, in quick succession, in your browser.
To see the exception in the logs and the different number of attachments with each refresh, I used "ab -A <user>:<password> -n 200 -c 10 <url_to_issue_with_image_attachments>". Then refresh the page in the browser while this runs.
I did this on Jira 4.3.4 and 5.0.

h3. Cause
This is caused by com.atlassian.core.util.thumbnail.Thumber.java : public boolean isFileSupportedImage(InputStream inputStream) which is not thread-safe and is called by multiple threads concurrently for the same instance of Thumber. To be more specific, these few lines cause all the havoc:
{code}
imageInfo.setInput(inputStream);
imageInfo.check();
for (String format : THUMBNAIL_FORMATS)
{
    if (format.equalsIgnoreCase(imageInfo.getFormatName()))
    {
        return true;
    }
}
return false;
{code}

h3. Resolution
Create an instance of ImageInfo for each call. See attached unified diff.
fields.summary: Attachments not shown on page refresh
Bundle newest JIM (which is compatible with new Add Project dialog)

fields.description: The Safari browser on iOS (version 5.1) seems to have problems with the drop-down lists used in the Create, Edit, and transition screens for issues. For example, creating an issue and choosing a project, or an issue type, or the assignee, and so on. The drop-down lists open but when you try to select the Project "Angry Nerds" for example, he inputs the project "Answers" instead.
fields.summary: Drop-down lists not working on iOS
Lock top navigation bar when scrolling

fields.description:
The problem I have is with system restore: 
* I have file called BACKUP.zip that I was trying to restore and mistakenly I was typing BACKUP.ZIP

The error I was getting was SAXParseException and not File not found.

See screencast in attachment or here: http://screencast.com/t/BjN7FXiotMW
fields.summary: Check for existence of file for System Restore should be case sensitive.
